div.head: Plants that are awkward to burn in the mold
div.ab: Mold them with two or three gates, which once reheated will open & it will be easier for you to take away the charcoal from inside.

div.head: Letters and molded paper
div.ab: Write with well gummed ink or with any color which has body & which does not erase once moistened with eau-de-vie. Then, place your paper on a clay slab & moisten it with eau-de-vie and cast on one side & the other.

div.head: For adorning beds, mirrors and similar things
div.ab: Model any drawing in half relief on a flat slate in order to set it on round or flat things. Cast with very fine tin, then you can gild it with gold leaf, and set it wherever you want. Fill the bottom of the relief with small rubies, orpiment, or any colored little grains.

div.head: To teach a dog well
div.ab: You need to keep your dog attached; when it does what you command, to win its love, give it a piece of cheese that was held under the armpit. This cheese would be a bad drug if the master, or the apprentice, is red-haired.

div.head: Molded waxes
div.ab: Figures of wax composed of ceruse & lead white are not for burning & melting in a mold where you want to cast gold & silver, for this would sour it. And then, if you think about taking away these waxes composed of things coming from the metals reheated in the mold, you will be wrong, because, the asperity of the fire, making them boil, the wax goes away & the composition of the ceruse or other metallic color, attached to the mold.
